clause.author: Brandon Kiem
clause.title: Roofs and ceilings of a sole-occupancy unit of a Class 2 building or a Class 4 part of a building

clause-variation.deleted-text: J3D7 does not apply in NSW.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Roof and ceiling insulation must achieve the minimum R-Value—

ol.li: in climate zone 1, in accordance with Tables J3D7a, J3D7b and J3D7c as applicable; and
in climate zone 2, in accordance with Tables J3D7d, J3D7e and J3D7f as applicable; and
in climate zone 3, in accordance with Tables J3D7g, J3D7h and J3D7i as applicable; and
in climate zone 4, in accordance with Tables J3D7j, J3D7k and J3D7l as applicable; and
in climate zone 5, in accordance with Tables J3D7m, J3D7n and J3D7o as applicable; and

in climate zone 6—
R3.5; or
if the roof contains reflective insulation, R3.0; and
in climate zones 7 and 8, in accordance with Tables J3D7p, J3D7q and J3D7r as applicable.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Reflective insulation installed to comply with (1) must—

ol.li: have a surface emittance of not more than 0.05; and
be adjacent to a roof space of not less than 20 mm; and
in climate zones 3 to 8, be downward facing.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: The thermal bridging in a metal-framed roof must be addressed as follows—

ol.li:
for a pitched roof with a horizontal ceiling—
achieving the Total R-Value in Table J3D7s, calculated using a method that accounts for the effects of thermal bridging; or
increasing the R-Value of the insulation between the ceiling frames by R0.5 more than the R-Value derived from (1); or
adding a continuous ceiling insulation layer with a minimum R-Value of R0.13 above or below the ceiling joists or the bottom chords of the trusses; or
achieving the required ceiling R-Value derived from (1) by stacking two layers of insulation immediately on top of each other, such that the top layer is orientated to cover the ceiling joists or bottom chord of the trusses and has an R-Value of at least R0.5; or

for a flat, skillion or cathedral roof—
achieving the Total R-Value in Table J3D7t, calculated using a method that accounts for the effects of thermal bridging; or
complying with Table J3D7u.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Where F8D5(1) applies, continuous insulation placed above the primary insulation layer to mitigate thermal bridging must have a vapour permeance of not less than that of the primary insulation layer.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Where, for operational or safety reasons, the area of ceiling insulation required is reduced, the loss of insulation must be compensated for in accordance with Table J3D7w.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Where the ceiling insulation required by (1) to (5) has an R-Value—

ol.li: greater than R3.0 and less than or equal to R4.5, it may be reduced to R3.0 within 450 mm of an external wall; or
greater than R4.5, it may be reduced to R3.0 within 450 mm of an external wall, provided all other required ceiling insulation is increased by R0.5.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: The requirements of (1) to (6) do not apply to roofs constructed using insulated sandwich panels.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Roofs constructed using insulated sandwich panels must achieve the minimum Total R-Value in Table J3D7x.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: In climate zones 1 to 5, the solar absorptance of the upper surface of a roof must not be more than 0.64.

table-reference.title: Flat concrete roof — minimum R-Value for ceiling insulation: climate zone 1

ol.li: SA = solar absorptance.
The R-Value of reflective insulation is not to be included in the R-Value of any under-roof or ceiling insulation.
R-Values listed are for the labelled, declared R-Value of insulation.

table-reference.title: Timber-framed pitched roof with horizontal ceiling — minimum R-Value for ceiling insulation: climate zone 1

ol.li: SA = solar absorptance.

A roof space is to be considered ‘vented’ if it—
has one wind-driven roof ventilator per 50 m2 of ceiling area with gable, eave or ridge vents; or
has one powered roof ventilator per 200 m2 of ceiling area with gable, eave or ridge vents; or
is a tiled roof without sarking-type material at roof level.
If a roof is not ‘vented’, it is a ‘standard’ roof.
The R-Value of reflective insulation is not to be included in the R-Value of any under-roof or ceiling insulation.
R-Values listed are for the labelled, declared R-Value of insulation.
X = not permitted.

table-reference.title: Timber-framed flat, skillion or cathedral roof — minimum R-Value for ceiling insulation: climate zone 1

ol.li: SA = solar absorptance.
The R-Value can be achieved by installing insulation under the roof or on top of the ceiling or a combination of both.
The R-Value of reflective insulation is not to be included in the R-Value of any under-roof or ceiling insulation.
R-Values listed are for the labelled, declared R-Value of insulation.
X = not permitted.

table-reference.author: Brandon Kiem

table-reference.title: Flat concrete roof — minimum R-Value for ceiling insulation: climate zones 7 and 8

The R-Value of reflective insulation is not to be included in the R-Value of any under-roof or ceiling insulation.
R-Values listed are for the labelled, declared R-Value of insulation.

table-reference.author: Brandon Kiem
table-reference.title: Timber-framed pitched roof with flat ceiling — minimum R-Value for ceiling insulation: climate zones 7 and 8

ol.li: SA = solar absorptance.

A roof is considered ‘vented’ if it—
has one wind-driven roof ventilator per 50 m2 of ceiling area with gable, eave or ridge vents; or
has one powered roof ventilator per 200 m2 of ceiling area with gable, eave or ridge vents; or
is ventilated to outdoor air through evenly distributed openings in accordance with Table F8D5; or
is a tiled roof without sarking-type material at roof level.
If a roof is not ‘vented’, it is a ‘standard’ roof.
The R-Value of reflective insulation is not to be included in the R-Value of any under-roof or ceiling insulation.
R-Values listed are for the labelled, declared R-Value of insulation.

ol.li: SA = solar absorptance.
The R-Value can be achieved by installing insulation under the roof or on top of the ceiling or a combination of both.
The R-Value of reflective insulation is not to be included in the R-Value of any under-roof or ceiling insulation.
R-Values listed are for the labelled, declared R-Value for insulation.

table-reference.title: Metal-framed flat, skillion or cathedral roof — minimum Total R-Value to account for thermal bridging

row.entry: Ceiling insulation R-Value from Tables J3D7a to J3D7r, and J3D7(1)(f) as applicable
Minimum Total R-Value to account for thermal bridging: heat flow down
Minimum Total R-Value to account for thermal bridging: heat flow up

ol.li: Minimum Total R-Values are in-situ values. They account for compression of insulation.
Direction of heat flow must be determined in accordance with Table J3D7v.

table-reference.title: Metal-framed flat, skillion or cathedral roof – thermal bridging mitigation

row.entry: Minimum ceiling R-Value from Tables J3D7a to J3D7r, and J3D7(1)(f) as applicable
Option 1– increase insulation between roof frame members to specified minimum R-Value
Option 2 – add a layer of continuous insulation with specified minimum R-Value above or below the roof frame members

ol.li: Minimum R-Values are in-situ values. They account for compression of insulation.
X= not permitted.

table-reference.author: Brandon Kiem
table-reference.title: Direction of heat flow
Adjusted minimum R-Value of ceiling insulation required to compensate for loss of ceiling insulation area

row.entry: Minimum R-Value of ceiling insulation required to satisfy J3D7(1) and J3D7(3)

ol.li: Interpolation is allowed for values between those shown.
X = not permitted.
